list.name: Changes
list.comment: continued to change to JSON format. Finished cal.py (generating the calendar without events)

task.summary: created project and added code that makes/appends to a text file with the correct number of days(leap years included I think) calendar. Next will try to figure out how to parse between everything and add events.
Added a new file to add events, and add them to the calendar on the correct day
bug fixes on make_new_event.py, started working on read_events_from_date.py

first complete version of the calendar. I have a feeling theres a few bugs that I have to fix. Current functionality: Generate a calendar file, Add events to that file with an index to another file containing event details, and reading those descriptions and titles from the date.

First semi working iteration of the ai integration thing. Basically now it can take natural language with the name of a date and output natural language of the descriptions and titles. It for some reason tries to contextualize that information. It also can't take the name of the month instead of the number. Sometimes works when provided with nth month instead of date. It also interprets dates as dd/mm/yy, which is interesting (despite their name, Nous Research is based in NY). Possibly a remnant from mixtrel? Next is to add this but for creating events.
Made the function for making events a tool for the assistant. Added speach to text so now you can ask it prompts through default microphone, and it will respond. STT is very buggy though.
Added text to speach to the output. Doesn't sound very good, so I will change this soon.
Added a much better text to speech. I decided not to use a more realistic voice to decrease the time until the user receives the response. Had to parse and filter the output a bit.
started to convert data storage to .json
continued to change to JSON format. Finished cal.py (generating the calendar without events)
